alert.note: Alert for McCreary (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 6:39PM EDT until July 12 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, McCreary, Wayne and Whitley. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 638 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williamsburg, Whitley City, Stearns, Marshes Siding, Blue Heron, Pine Knot, Wiborg, Strunk, Beulah Heights, Co- Operative, Parkers Lake, Ritner, Hollyhill, Slavens, Honeybee, Duckrun, Kidds Crossing, Denney, Cumberland Falls S.P. and Bounty. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
